comment_text: Why am I here?
im an athiest but, thank you God for sal.

Khan, has in many  respects resurrected the concept of Alexander the Greats vision of having a large library which contains the knowledge of the  world so people could go and learn and self teach themselves for free. The Khan academy is the Modern Library of Alexandria.   Nobel Prize Material.

500 million is ridiculous. That is quite unrealistic. Though I like the basic idea of a teaching videogame. It can certainly be done but I'm almost certain, there are cheaper (similarly effective) ways to do so. - Fairly recently, a Kickstarter project actually got through, doing something like that.
I like how the interviewee sticks with Sal much longer than the other two guys but I feel, the comparions ins't fair. Sal does a longterm life project. The other two are comparably short-termed.
ha ha me too...

Khan is awesome because he talks simple, in great simple structure, has pleasant voice, makes it visible and gives nothing extra and destructive. That's how a real teacher should be. Many teachers spend a lot of student's time to talk about themselves and other things that are not related to the material. Thank you Salman for your great job!keep it up.
the 2 other guests disliked this
Wow Sal, you really are a god amongst men. You should be more famous then any actor or musician. People like you give me a little faith that humanity might last awhile longer!

Sal is so awsome. I remember before I learned about him, I was always frustrated as hell about looking for complete explinations about things. I really am thankful that someone like this has the patience, understanding, and inteligence to show anyone and everyone things that he knows. Your awsome sal!

I'm confident that there is a problem in our education, all the time I thought it was my fault and the fault of other kids who didn't like school or were bad at it. But it isn't us, it is education itself which is so unpersonal and so mechenical in a sense that we get distant from it and then start to despise it.

I'm in college now but if I had your videos when I was in highschool and even elementary I would have developed in a diffrent way.
